name: Weight loss – No breakfast – Home training
strategy:
## Global Strategy
- Short name: Sustainable caloric deficit with strength focus
- High-level description: The strategy focuses on a moderate caloric deficit while maintaining muscle mass through full-body strength training at home.

## Training Philosophy
Low-impact full-body workouts 3–4 times per week using dumbbells and bodyweight exercises.

## Nutrition Philosophy
Calories redistributed across lunch and dinner only, ensuring adequate protein intake despite skipping breakfast.

## Pros
- Sustainable
- Easy to follow at home

## Cons
- Slower fat loss compared to aggressive deficits
evaluation: The strategy is safe and realistic for a beginner. Skipping breakfast is properly handled by redistributing calories later in the day.

final_plan.nutrition: Focus on two main meals (lunch and dinner) with high protein content. Snacks are optional. Hydration and fiber intake are emphasized.
final_plan.training: 3 full-body sessions per week focusing on compound movements (squats, push-ups, rows) with progressive overload.
final_plan.notes: Breakfast removed. Calories redistributed to lunch and dinner.

name: Muscle gain – Full gym – 5h/week
strategy:
## Global Strategy
- Short name: Progressive hypertrophy
- High-level description: A structured hypertrophy program combining progressive overload and adequate caloric surplus.

## Training Philosophy
Split training (upper/lower) 4–5 times per week.

## Nutrition Philosophy
Slight caloric surplus with high protein intake spread evenly across meals.

## Pros
- Efficient muscle gain
- Clear progression

## Cons
- Requires consistency
evaluation: The strategy matches the user's goal and available time. Full gym access allows optimal exercise selection.

final_plan.nutrition: 4 meals per day with emphasis on protein and complex carbohydrates to support muscle growth.
final_plan.training: Upper/lower split with compound lifts (squat, bench press, rows) and accessory work.
final_plan.notes: Volume and intensity adapted to intermediate level.

name: Body recomposition – Intermediate – No dairy
strategy:
## Global Strategy
- Short name: Recomposition via strength and nutrition control
- High-level description: Maintain calories around maintenance while improving body composition through structured training.

## Training Philosophy
Full-body training with progressive overload.

## Nutrition Philosophy
Balanced macros without dairy, using alternative protein sources.

## Pros
- Improves strength and physique

## Cons
- Results slower than pure bulk or cut
evaluation: The plan respects dietary constraints and supports recomposition effectively.

final_plan.nutrition: Maintenance calories with plant-based or meat protein sources replacing dairy.
final_plan.notes: All dairy products replaced with suitable alternatives.

name: Knee pain – Low impact training

profile.constraints: Knee pain, no jumping or running

strategy:
## Global Strategy
- Short name: Joint-friendly fitness
- High-level description: Improve overall fitness while protecting knee joints.

## Training Philosophy
Low-impact exercises focusing on strength and mobility.

## Nutrition Philosophy
Balanced diet supporting recovery and joint health.

## Pros
- Safe
- Low injury risk

## Cons
- Limited cardio intensity
evaluation: The strategy avoids high-impact movements and is well-suited for knee pain.

final_plan.training: Strength exercises like glute bridges, seated upper body work, cycling or walking.
final_plan.notes: All jumping and running movements excluded.

name: Vegan – Protein constraints
strategy:
## Global Strategy
- Short name: Vegan hypertrophy
- High-level description: Muscle gain through plant-based nutrition and structured resistance training.

## Training Philosophy
Hypertrophy-oriented split training.

## Nutrition Philosophy
High-protein vegan diet using legumes, tofu, tempeh, and supplements if needed.

## Pros
- Ethical
- Sustainable

## Cons
- Requires careful nutrition planning
evaluation: Protein constraints are properly addressed with plant-based alternatives.

final_plan.nutrition: Protein spread across meals using diverse vegan sources.
final_plan.training: 4 gym sessions per week focusing on progressive overload.
final_plan.notes: Protein intake carefully planned despite vegan constraints.

name: Beginner – Back pain – No deadlifts
strategy:
## Global Strategy
- Short name: Back-safe beginner fitness
- High-level description: Build basic strength while protecting the lower back.

## Training Philosophy
Core stability and controlled movements.

## Nutrition Philosophy
Balanced diet supporting recovery.

## Pros
- Safe for beginners

## Cons
- Limited exercise selection
evaluation: The plan avoids spinal loading and is appropriate for back pain.

final_plan.training: Exercises like split squats, push-ups, resistance band rows, core stability work.
final_plan.notes: Deadlifts and heavy spinal loading removed.
